newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Four killed in Vietnam by war-era bomb.
newsitem.headline: Four killed in Vietnam by war-era bomb.

text.p: Three adults and one child were killed and four people injured in central Vietnam when a war-era bomb exploded, a district official said on Monday.
The official said one of the victims triggered Saturday's explosion in Binh Dinh province by sawing through the bomb casement for scrap iron.
Unexploded ordnance from the Vietnam War, which ended in 1975, remains a lethal hazard in many parts of the country, killing dozens of people every year.
